pageContext.claim: “She's creating five, six million -- workforce, where they're training people that have never done this, and I think they're up to almost six million people right now being trained by the companies, cause the companies can do it better than the government, right?”
pageContext.analysis: Ivanka Trump, the president's daughter, has touted the fact that there are 6 million jobs available in the country because of a "skills gaps" -- many potential workers don't have the right qualifications to take jobs that are currently open. Trump signed an executive order to create a National Council for the American Worker that would devise a unified workforce strategy and promote vocational training. The president mixes up these facts and wrongly suggests his daughter has actually arranged for the training of 6 million people.
